Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • Driver

  • public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    The Driver class is responsible for controlling the flow of the entire program as well as executing it. It has the main method which creates a new instance of itself. It sets up the JFrame output window, stores the score and username of the current player, displays errors, switches screens, and uses a KeyListener for the chm file.

    Instance Variables:

    frame Creates a static instance of the JFrame class entitled "Paint Me a Picture!"

    username Creates a static instance of the String class and stores the username of the current player.

    score Integer storing the score of the current player, starts at 1000.

    Version:
    FINAL - June 10, 2016
    Author:
    Phaze Inc.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Driver

        public Driver()
        The constructor sets up the JFrame and main KeyListener. It sets the size to 1200x900 and resizability to false. The default close operation is to exit on close and the frame is made visible. An instance of the SplashScreen class is added and a KeyListener for the chm file is added to the frame.

    • Method Detail

      • changeScreens

        public static void changeScreens(java.lang.String className)
        The static changeScreens() method updates the JFrame to display the current screen based on a JPanel. It uses the destination class name as a string parameter and assigns that String as a Class to a Class instance. Then, everything is removed from the content pane and a new instance of the class is added. The ClassNotFoundException, InstantiationException, and IllegalAccessException are all caught. The frame is then revalidated and repainted.

        Local Variables:

        c Creates an instance of the Class variables based on a Class input.

        Parameters:
        className - Instance of the String class representing another class in the program.

      • error

        public static void error(java.lang.String message,
                         java.lang.String title)
        The static error method creates an isntance of JOPtionPane as an error message. This is based on thhe parameters of message and title.
        Parameters:
        message - Instance of the String class containing the message to be displayed to the user.
        title - Instance of the String class containing the title to be displayed to the user.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method runs the program, it creates an instance of this class, the Driver class.
        Parameters:
        args - Array of String objects containing command line arguments when running the program.
